intro: Callianthemum alatavicum, commonly known as the Alataw Valley anemone, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many showy and often toxic flowering plants. The plant produces delicate, white or pale pink flowers with a distinctive central cluster of stamens. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soil and full sun. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
